A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
A natural progression. It felt like exactly where the saga should have gone. Very different from what people tend to expect\, so I have little doubt that a lot of fans will hate it. But it was certainly a gripping experience\, to say the least.

I thoroughly enjoyed seeig where the new characters get to in their arcs. I feel that Rey still isn't super great as a character\, but as a vessel to drive the story\, she does fine. Finn is muted from his TFA appearance\, but this works in his favor as he's a lot more openly tolerable and more enjoyable to watch. Poe gets the best end of the stick\, going from more or less a side character to the star of the B-plot

My biggest complaint is a small one\, and\, to beat a dead horse\, the porgs. They exist only to be "adorable and hilarious"\, and only for merchandising's sake. They added nothing to the film and honestly\, took away from it on some level. The audience laughed at their antics while I shook my head.
